helpDropdownItems.title: What is an IK statement?
helpDropdownItems.text:
The statement from the individual account, or ‘IK statement’ for short, is your personal cash ledger at the AHV. This document lists the necessary information with which your AHV pension can be calculated.

Please note:
If you are not due to retire soon, a calculation of your AHV pension from your current IK statement is just a theoretical figure at the current juncture! It is likely that the figure that is calculated will have changed by the time you retire.

helpDropdownItems.title: Ordering an IK statement
helpDropdownItems.text:
You can either search for your compensation fund or order a complete statement.

<0>Click here to search for your compensation fund.>>

<1>You can order all your statements / an aggregate statement here. >>

Ordering your IK statement is free of charge.

Please note that it can take 3 - 4 weeks until the compensation fund sends you your IK statement by post. Until you receive your statement, moneto recommends that you continue using a quick calculation or assumption. When your financial security is at stake, swift action is important!

helpDropdownItems.title: Tips for when you receive the IK statement
helpDropdownItems.text:
moneto strongly recommends that you check the IK statement upon receipt for the following points:

- Are all your employers listed?
- Are the years (column 5) continuous or interrupted where they should not be?
- Are the annual incomes (column 6) consistent with the years and employers?



This is for the following reason: If data is missing or incorrect, you have 30 days after receiving the IK statement to request a correction’ from your compensation fund. After these 30 days, the IK statement is considered correct and can no longer be contested. Compensation funds recommend: Order a new IK statement every five years. Reason: If wage statements or pay slips are no longer available, it will be difficult to prove any contentious points.

helpDropdownItems.title: Quick calculation
helpDropdownItems.text:
The quick calculation gives you a rough estimate of how high your AHV pension might be.

AHV contributions:
Within Switzerland, most people pay their AHV contributions for the first time when they start their apprenticeship or receive their first wages.

Years without AHV minimum contributions:
The following sample situations can lead to a scenario in which a person would have years without AHV minimum contributions:

- A student pays no voluntary AHV contributions while they are studying and begins their working life at the age of 25. In this case, 4 years should be entered (calculate from age 21).

- A foreign citizen, 40 years old, takes a job in Switzerland. In this case, 19 years should be entered (calculate from age 21).

- A welfare recipient receives social welfare benefits for 3 years. Before that, the person was unemployed for 2 years. In this case, 3 years should be entered, as unemployment benefit incorporates AHV contributions.

helpDropdownItems.title: Assumption
helpDropdownItems.text: Select the assumption of your choice. The figures generated are based on the current statutory figures taking the entire contribution period into account (no missing contribution years).
